data.title: A full tab bar has a 1px wide section to the left of the actions that has the hand cursor but doesn't work as expected
data.body:
Testing #14016

This potentially also happens on the very edge of a non-full tab bar, dragging on this specific spot does not drag the editor group as I would expect. I assume that there is a CSS cursor style in a `:hover` rule that does not match the element that you actually grab.

![img_20161025_101521](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/19696587/9da21630-9a9c-11e6-8893-d20327efd1fd.jpg)

data.title: Powershell last statement output not seen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.7.2

Steps to Reproduce:

This shows me '1' in debug console
$a = 1
Write-Host $a
Exit

This shows me nothing in debug console
$a = 1
Write-Host $a

data.title: Editor group layout commands should work when there is only a single editor group
data.body:
Testing #14016

While it makes sense that the action is disabled in the open editors view, if it's triggered via the keybindings or command palette I think the editor group layout change should still be performed.

It feels broken that I hit shift+alt+1 and don't see the splitter icon change.

data.title: Reconsider editor group layout keybindings
data.body:
Testing #14016

I'm not sure this is the best use of these keybindings for the following reasons:
- They don't use the fact that the keys 1, 2, 3 are being used, it might be better to keep them on hand for something that takes advantage of this?
- Really only toggle needs to be bound
- It's strange that <kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>alt</kbd> is being used when currently this combination is used exclusively for commands inside the editor

As an alternative, I'm not sure on it's usage but I suggest taking `editor.action.jumpToBracket`'s keybinding <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>\</kbd> for `workbench.action.toggleEditorGroupLayout` as <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>\</kbd> is used to split the editor.

data.title: Allow customization of the default panel height

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14297

Since the panel does not auto size to the content like the sidebar does (when double clicking sash), it makes sense to be able to set how large the user wants the default panel to be.

Some things to consider:
- What if the user uses vscode on both horizontal and vertical monitors?
- Perhaps it would make sense to allow both percentage-based and absolute values?

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13898

data.body:
While testing #14015 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hide sidebar
2. Move to left/right
3. Sidebar is toggled open

data.title: multi target debugging: floating debug action widget needs to show session
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14171:

Since we will probably continue to use the floating debug action widget, we will have to improve how we show the current debug session. Without that it is pretty difficult to understand what the action buttons do because they depend on what is currently selected in the CALLSTACK view.

I suggest to show the current debug session on the floating debug action widget (ideally as a switcher drop-down). If we show this drop-down menu on the right hand-side of the widget, we could easily add and remove it as sessions come and go without changing the location of the individual buttons (this is important if a user wants to press the continue button for multiple sessions without having to track the location of the button). In addition we have to take into account that some sessions might add addition buttons (e.g. for back-in-time-debugging). To accommodate for this I suggest that we have only a single floating debug action widget that is multiplexed between the sessions and shows the union of all buttons used by the sessions, but disables the buttons that are not configured for the sessions.

data.title: Option to duplicate file/folder in "explore" sidebar and then rename
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (14393)

Would like to be able to right click on a file/folder in the explore sidebar and have the option to duplicate and rename that item. Thanks!

(I looked through open issues and didn't see this but apologies if I missed it)

data.title: Deleting `workbench.statusBar.visible` doesn't update View menu
data.body:
While testing #14015
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `workbench.statusBar.visible` to false in `settings.json`.
2. Delete it, hit save.
3. Status Bar is shown
4. View menu still has "Show status bar" action (which actually hides status bar if clicked)

data.title: Code formatting for multiple languages in one file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

this is a feature request and not an issue.

Please give code formatting for multiple languages in one file. As example: If you are having HTML and PHP code in a php-file, then you won't get formatted HTML code and you have to format your HTML code manually. 

As solution, it would be nice to associate a extension to multiple languages in the settings:
`"files.associations": {
   "*.php": ["php", "html"]
}`

Thanks and best regards!

data.title: Word suggestion seems to have been broken for a couple of days: existing word is not overriden
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607

When word suggestion is invoked with Ctrl+space after some existing prefix, the list is correctly displayed and filtered but does not overwrite existing prefix/word when validated. The completion is simply appended after the current cursor position.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a text file with "--disable-extensions"
2. type 'foobar'
3. move back the cursor three times 
4. trigger suggestion with ctrl+space: 'foobar' is correctly displayed but not highlighted
5. accept suggestion with enter: foobar is appended in the middle, was expecting an identity transformation

data.title: vscode.extensions Doesn't Update On Installing / Removing / Disabling Extensions without restarting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I need to configure my extension [code-settings-sync](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Shan.code-settings-sync) with the feature that when user installs the extension and doesnt restart the vscode and neither enable the extension, i need to make the sync backup for that extension when installed.

---

**Installation Process : when installed and not restarted.**


**Expected Behaviour :**
`vscode.extensions.all` should show the newly installed extension with enabled `false` flag

So i can get that extension and make a sync.

**Current Behaviour**
It doenst appear in `vscode.extensions.all` until i restart the code by clicking the enable button or other way.

---

**Uninstall Process : when uninstalled and not restarted.**

**Expected Behaviour :**
`vscode.extensions.all` should not show that extension , or some flag like removed `true`

So i can get that extension remove from user's list and make a sync excluding that extension.

**Current Behaviour**
It doenst remove from `vscode.extensions.all` until i restart the code

---

This is the scenario for installing/ uninstalling.
Same goes for disable and enabling the extension i need to know which extensions are disabled or enabled.

data.title: [Request] Keybinding / scriptability of target pane for opening file with Ctrl/Cmd-P
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12)

I think it would be quite useful if users could open a file directly into the right pane instead of opening said file then dragging the tab to the right part of the screen.

I am really requesting this so that I can eventually get behaviour similar to `:vnew` in https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim.

```
:[N]vne[w] [++opt] [+cmd] [file]            *:vne* *:vnew*
        Like |:new|, but split vertically.  If 'equalalways' is set
        and 'eadirection' isn't "ver" the windows will be spread out
        horizontally, unless a width was specified.
```

data.title: Having Invalid extension id results in 'Server returned 400'
data.body:
Testing #14291
- I updated my extension (999 Martins Extension Pack Testing ) with a new version

``` json
{
    "name": "999-martin-pack",
    "displayName": "999 Martins Extension Pack Testing",
    "description": "999 Martins Extension Pack Testing",
    "version": "1.0.3",
    "publisher": "aeschli",
    "engines": {
        "vscode": "^1.6.0"
    },
    "categories": [
        "Other"
    ],
    "galleryBanner": {
        "color": "#882299",
        "theme": "light"
    },
    "license": "MIT",
    "extensionDependencies": [
        "aeschli.vscode-css-formatter",
        "kisstkondoros.csstriggers",
        "999-martin-pack"
    ]
}
```

Note the extension has a circular dependency to itself.
- Install the extension using the extensions viewlet
  Error shows: 'Server returned 400'
- In the extension view, clicking on the 'Dependecies' tab result in endless progress balls

data.title: New CSS property "contain"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any .css file.
2. Write 'contain: ...'.
3. Get warning "[css] Unknown property".

According to [spec](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-containment) we've got new CSS property 'contain'. Yep, I know that it's draft still, but people are already using it in production and they don't want to get warnings about that. Can you add this property to whitelist?

Press ok

A single prompt would do

data.title: Improve prompt when installing extension packs
data.body:
Testing #14291
- create an extension pack (see #14291)
- install the extension pack. You are prompted with:

> Installing 'Martins Favourite Extensions' also installs its dependencies. Would you like to continue?

As a user, is it something to worry about? Should I say yes or no? 

I guess the prompt can be removed. Else it can be replaced with an more of an information.
Press ok to install 'Martins Favourite Extensions' and 6 dependencies.

data.title: VSCode refuses to open plain text file that begins with digits

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.7.0-insider (5bafcdb3d67b29b1f4667a3f497ac05a41dde667, 2016-10-25T06:11:16.069Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

| Extension | Author | Version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| html-snippets | abusaidm | 0.0.18 |
| vscode-caniuse | akamud | 0.5.3 |
| Bookmarks | alefragnani | 0.9.2 |
| code-gnu-global | austin | 0.2.1 |
| gitignore | codezombiech | 0.2.0 |
| vscode-markdownlint | DavidAnson | 0.5.0 |
| jshint | dbaeumer | 0.10.15 |
| vscode-eslint | dbaeumer | 1.0.8 |
| githistory | donjayamanne | 0.1.0 |
| python | donjayamanne | 0.5.0 |
| xml | DotJoshJohnson | 1.6.0 |
| escaping-characters | drphrozen | 1.0.0 |
| EditorConfig | EditorConfig | 0.3.4 |
| tslint | eg2 | 0.5.39 |
| matlab | Gimly81 | 0.4.0 |
| CppSnippets | hars | 0.0.5 |
| vscode-firefox-debug | hbenl | 0.7.0 |
| icalendar | AF4JM | 0.0.1 |
| Ionide-fsharp | Ionide | 2.8.2 |
| vstsbuildstatus | jeppeandersen | 0.5.0 |
| docthis | joelday | 0.3.5 |
| docomment | k--kato | 0.0.7 |
| HTMLHint | mkaufman | 0.0.3 |
| cpptools | ms-vscode | 0.9.2 |
| csharp | ms-vscode | 1.4.1 |
| mono-debug | ms-vscode | 0.11.0 |
| PowerShell | ms-vscode | 0.7.2 |
| Theme-MarkdownKit | ms-vscode | 0.1.1 |
| team | ms-vsts | 1.108.0 |
| debugger-for-chrome | msjsdiag | 2.0.0 |
| Ruby | rebornix | 0.10.1 |
| yo | samverschueren | 0.9.0 |
| Spell | seanmcbreen | 0.8.6 |
| code-settings-sync | Shan | 2.3.3 |
| vscode-hexdump | slevesque | 1.0.1 |
| lodash-snippets | tomphilbin | 0.7.0 |
| change-case | wmaurer | 0.4.1 |
| JavaScriptSnippets | xabikos | 1.2.0 |

---

Steps to Reproduce:

I have a 74.6MB plain text file (with a client's HR data), tried to use VSCode to find out if there was a byte-order mark or whatever at the beginning of the file, it refused to open.  The vscode-hexdump extension also crashed trying to open the file.  So opened the file in Visual Studio's binary editor.  First 6 bytes are digits, then a bunch of spaces.  Screen clip attached (deliberately chopped down to omit PII, but it clearly shows there's no stray bytes, nor BOM, at the beginning of the file).

![vscode bin bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/849948/19687204/955d974c-9a92-11e6-97cb-14a8e945c4c4.png)

data.title: VS Code does not show any response when attaching to Shared Process
data.body:
Testing #14341 
- VSCode Version: Latest Insiders
- OS Version: Mac OS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up VS Code development workspace
2. Launch vs code dev using ./scripts/code.sh
3. From VS Code dev workspace, Launch attach to shared process
4. Every thing works  
5. Stop the shared process launch
6. Configure the shared process launch to use `node2` type
7. Start the launch
8. It fails as expected
9. Revert back to `node` type
10. Start the launch

> > Nothing happens
> > Expected atleast to show some error message if it fails
